alerts.text: Heavy rain = Colington Cocktail. Septic fields are flushed. Avoid the sound for 24 hours.
Bridge closed to high-profile vehicles. Gusts over 60 mph.
White-knuckle bridge crossing. High wind advisory in effect.
Frost on the windshield. Check the hose bibs and cover the tender plants.
Dog days. AC working overtime. Don't leave anything in the truck that can melt.
Greenhead fly conditions. Hot, humid, no wind. Stay off the marsh trails unless you enjoy blood loss.
Nor'easter pattern. Sound will stack up on the west side. Check your dock lines.
Bridge deck ices before the roads. The Wright Memorial Bridge is a skating rink right now.
Triple digits on the heat index. Hydrate or die. The AC will be working overtime.
Rip current conditions. NE wind stacking the surf. Swim near a lifeguard or don't swim at all.
Soft sand on the 4x4 beaches. Air down to 15 PSI or plan on getting stuck. Tow trucks are busy.
East wind pushing jellies to shore. Watch where you step. Bring the meat tenderizer.
Fog likely on the beach road. The Outer Banks disappear act. Headlights on, slow down.

micro_seasons.name: Ghost Season
micro_seasons.vibe: Only contractors and cops on the road. Restaurants on winter hours. Locals reclaim the bar stools.

micro_seasons.name: The Pollening
micro_seasons.vibe: The loblolly pines explode. Everything coated in neon yellow dust. Don't bother washing the truck.

micro_seasons.name: Cobia Season
micro_seasons.vibe: Boats with spotting towers cruising the oceanfront, hunting for The Man in the Brown Suit.

micro_seasons.name: Midge Hatch
micro_seasons.vibe: Calm air = fuzzy bills. Millions of non-biting midges coating the north side of every white house.

micro_seasons.name: Changeover Saturday
micro_seasons.vibe: Gridlock on the bypass. The Great Tourist Migration. Do not leave the house between 10 and 4.

micro_seasons.name: Hurricane Season
micro_seasons.vibe: Checking the NHC website every 6 hours. Judging neighbors' plywood. Generator testing rituals.

micro_seasons.name: Locals Summer
micro_seasons.vibe: Water's still warm, tourists are gone, rates are down. The best time to be alive on the island.

micro_seasons.name: Tundra Swan Season
micro_seasons.vibe: Fields on the mainland turn white with birds. Chaotic honking at Alligator River refuge.

micro_seasons.name: Jellyfish Season
micro_seasons.vibe: Sea nettles owning the sound. Every swim ends with the vinegar bottle. Kids screaming on the beach.

micro_seasons.name: Red Drum Run
micro_seasons.vibe: Big reds cruising the shallows. Every boat with a fishfinder is out there. The tackle shop parking lot is full by 6 AM.

micro_seasons.name: Snowbird Exodus
micro_seasons.vibe: Ohio plates heading north. For Sale signs going up. The year-rounders finally get their island back.

micro_seasons.name: Fall Bluefish Blitz
micro_seasons.vibe: Blues and stripers running the beach. Trucks lined up on Jennette's Pier. Blood and scales everywhere.

micro_seasons.name: Beach Wedding Season
micro_seasons.vibe: White tents on every beach access. Bridesmaids in heels sinking in sand. Drunk uncles stumbling toward the waves.

micro_seasons.name: Spring Break
micro_seasons.vibe: College kids discovering the Outer Banks exists. The Brewing Station is packed. Noise complaints spike.

sensory.text: West wind carrying peat smoke from the mainland fires. Smells like campfire and burning dirt.
North wind bringing the sulfur scent of exposed mud flats and crab pots.
Can hear the ocean from the soundside today. That freight-train rumble means the surf is up.
Low tide funk. The marsh is breathing. That sulfur smell means the fiddler crabs are out.
Fish cleaning station working overtime. Someone had a good day on the water.
Cicadas hitting that evening crescendo. The sound wall of summer.
Prop planes droning from First Flight. Banner planes advertising all-you-can-eat crab legs.
Coconut sunscreen haze at every beach access. Summer in a smell.
Nags Head Pier is groaning in the wind. That old wood knows things.
Seagull feeding frenzy at the beach. Someone opened a bag of chips. War has begun.
Salt spray coating everything. Your windows, your car, your sunglasses. The ocean is claiming its territory.

infrastructure.text: Boat ramp's slick after rain. The algae makes it a skating rink. Take it slow or watch your truck slide in.
Gate barcode reader gets temperamental in humidity. Have your code ready to punch in manually.
Marina fuel dock exposed in this wind. Fenders out, approach slow, or wait for it to lay down.
Bypass floods before Beach Road in heavy rain. The low spot near milepost 9 goes first.
Beach Road crawling with rental bikes and confused tourists. Take the bypass if you value your sanity.
Beach Road floods from the sound side before the ocean side. The low spots near Jockey's Ridge go first.
Piers close when the weather turns. Check before you drive out there with all your gear.
Jockey's Ridge sandblasting anyone dumb enough to climb it. Your legs will be exfoliated whether you like it or not.
Beach access parking is a blood sport right now. Cobia Street and Epstein Street are war zones.
Rainy day = outlet mall gridlock. Every tourist who can't beach is shopping. Avoid the 158/64 intersection.

flooding_zones.first_to_flood: The S-Curve near the Fire Station
flooding_zones.context: When sound level hits 2.5+ ft with SW wind, the S-Curve goes first.
